newsitem.title: USA: Healthdyne urges Invacare bid rejection.
newsitem.headline: Healthdyne urges Invacare bid rejection.

text.p: Healthdyne Technologies Inc said Thursday that its board of directors unanimously recommends that shareholders reject Invacare Corp's revised tender offer of $13.50 per share for shares of the company and that shareholders not tender any of their shares.
The board said a sale of the company at this time is not in the best interests of the company or its shareholders.
The company said it expects first quarter results to be "excellent," driven by strong revenue growth from its new products, and to meet or exceed analysts' estimates.
According to First Call, the consensus estimate for Healthdyne's first quarter is $0.13 a share, compared with for $0.14 the previous first quarter.

In a letter to A. Malachi Mixon, chief executive officer of Invacare, Healthdyne Chairman Parker Petit said he "cannot fathom" how Mixon could believe that a $0.50 per share increase in its offer would change Healthdyne's position and encourage the board to negotiate with him.
